website_summaries.verdict: Sensor tech and built-in Alexa access make this an intriguing smart switch -- we just wish it'd dim the lights.
pros: Ecobee's smart switch is relatively easy to install, and it includes built-in sensors for motion and ambient light that you won't find in competing switches from WeMo or Lutron
It's compatible with IFTTT, SmartThings and all major voice platforms, and even has Alexa built in
cons: The Switch Plus won't dim the lights, and it won't work in three-way switch setups where more than one switch is wired to the same light
It also won't work as an external temperature sensor for Ecobee thermostats until a software update arrives this summer

customer_reviews.title: Slow and buggy
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes it is pretty slow to respond. The blue light will be on and it understood what you asked but it sits for 5+ seconds before executing. All my other Echo devices are executing in about 1 second or less. Loses my internet connection daily and can’t figure out how to fix itself without a reboot.
customer_reviews.author: Scott K

customer_reviews.title: Not ready
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for the ecobee switch as I use two ecobee thermostats and control everything in my house with Alexa but sadly it is just not ready for mass market. First off if you have automatic radio channels enabled on your router (like any modern day network defaults to) stop right there. You will have to disable your 5G or rename it just to get it to connect! Second no dimming support! Seriously? Third the mounting plate is so thick, it won’t fit under a normal face plate with other switches. Fourth, I had read you can use the switch as a sensor for your thermostat but they have yet to add support for it.
customer_reviews.author: Travis M.

customer_reviews.title: Poor Alexa Integration
customer_reviews.text: After buying into the Alexa world, I decided to replace by Ecobee3 thermostats with the Ecobee4 version to have the Alexa integration. That integration is BAD. Probably because there is some additional step that Ecobee needs to take that Amazon products (like Echo Dots) do not, the Alexa commands are hit and miss and not a reliable option. Why I ever decided to buy the Switch+ (knowing this about the Ecobee4) is beyond me now. So, know that this product has extremely poor Alexa integration. With three of these around my house, I can safely say that no one should buy it for Alexa use. The motion detection and light control are really the only positives here.
customer_reviews.author: FunShop

customer_reviews.title: Alexa integration need some serious work.
customer_reviews.text: All of the reviews of Alexa being basically useless are true. The room this in has a a wifi access point about 6 feet away in line of sight and Alexa still has multiple errors and failure to process requests. Good news, you can just use Google assistant on your phone and it can control the switch more efficiently.
customer_reviews.author: AHC

customer_reviews.title: It just doesn’t last
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived without any issues and I had it professionally installed by an electrician. Connection was simple and while the microphone didn’t pick up voice from as far away as one is normally used to with any Alexa device, it worked fine. The problem is that it lasted less than one month before it went dead. I called the electrician again to see if it was something with the connection but it wasn’t, so I have a total expense of about $300 for something that worked for a total of 27 days. I think it’s a great idea but the product is not strong enough for the cost it has.
customer_reviews.author: MCP

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as in room thermostat
customer_reviews.text: Just a heads up for everyone purchasing this switch I just installed 3 of these today and the thermostat feature was not working, I contacted Ecobee support to find out that the integration feature was pulled back as they had issues with it, and do not know if it will ever work and do not have any answers. I asked when they may know for sure when they will have an answer and was told they will contact me and if I do not hear from anyone call back in a month. After spending close to $800 I am not very happy at this time, I was about to purchase 4 more of these switches glad I did not.
customer_reviews.author: reena

customer_reviews.title: Lacks critical features
customer_reviews.text: It does a lot of things but falls short on too many for me. I returned it. The main no go for me was the lack of drop-in calling, I wanted to be able to use it as a intercom replacement. The good: Motion sensing General Alexa usage like timers, voice control of home, plays music Fit well with my Lutron Casetta and GE-Jasco zwave switches Hopeful about: Should get temperature and presence sensing soon. What I couldn't get past: Can't join music groups Can't drop-in, call, or leave messages "yet" Can't control duration lights stay on after presence is sensed.
customer_reviews.author: CharlesF

customer_reviews.title: Best and smartest, smart lightswitch yet!
customer_reviews.text: Hpw many light switches do you have that you can talk to? This switch can be controlled by voice using the Alexa integration. It can also tell you the weather, play music and anything else alexa can do. It can also be controlled by the ecobee app on your phone and by various other home automation controllers. It has a built in night light and motion sensor that can be used to automatically turn it on and off. If you have an ecobee thermostat, you will be able to use it as a remote temperature sensor with a future firmware upgrade. It's a lightswitch and so much more.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Not ready for prime time
customer_reviews.text: This switch sometimes goes completely offline (so far it has done it twice now), and the only way to get it back up is to flip the breaker. It has difficulty "hearing" Alexa commands. It does NOT function as a room temperature sensor at this time. No idea why they released the product in this condition. Should've gotten a cheaper switch and an Amazon Echo.
customer_reviews.author: Kosoku

customer_reviews.title: Included when purchased Ecobee, not worth the hassle.
customer_reviews.text: Some good, some bad. Had to reset several times to try and get the thing working correctly. The motion sensor is finicky. Sometimes it seems to work, other times doesn't. Doesn't matter conditions (light in room or not). Lights will suddenly come on and stay on. Even during the daytime with light coming through window. The "alexa" capability is limited and honestly not worth the additional money the light switch costs you. My GE lightswitch and smartthings sensor do a much better job then this. It doesn't have a temperature sensor so no real use with the Ecobee. Would never purchase this as a stand alone device. Way better options out there.
customer_reviews.author: RPK

customer_reviews.title: Almost happy with it ....
customer_reviews.text: Overall it works, however it has moments where it's offline or it develops an attitude. It was detected by smart things however it wasn't smooth. Would I purchase again... probably not I would go with a smart things switch and an alexa device.
customer_reviews.author: Euriska

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing, lacks features
customer_reviews.text: I feel duped. All this is good for is a push button light switch. It has zero benefit with the ecobee thermostat. You’d assume at least it would be a temperature sensor paired with the thermostat. Nope. Or maybe sync it’s Alexa functionality with a speaker as a group like all other Alexa devices. Nope. And the microphone practically needs to be yelled at to wake up. All my other devices have been totally fine and I feel like I spent $75 to downgrade my smart home. This product needs the features you assume it would have at this price and branding of ecobee.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation, setup
customer_reviews.text: This switch does what it claims and does it well. Installation was a breeze and if unsure, you can always revert back to their video step-by-step instructions. Pros: Easy installation, setup, and configuration. Features work as advertised. Alexa integration is great. Cons: Though not advertised, there's no dimming option. There's no way to disabled auto-on during set hours, this means if you use the feature in a bedroom, lights will come on throughout the night as you toss and turn in bed. Let's hope these features are eventually integrated. Also, the drop-in skill would be great. Overall, its a great product, with excellent support. Ecobee is always responsive if you need assistance.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Olsen

customer_reviews.title: Good for single gang use, works great in the bathroom
customer_reviews.text: Pigtails make the wiring really easy. The mounting tabs at the top and bottom of the switch are very thick. Is you use this in a single gang box with the included trim plate, this won’t be an issue, but if used in a multi-gang box then the trim plate will stick out from the wall. I may need to file it down to improve the fit. Bought this together with the Ecobee Smart Thermostat basically for free during a sale. I use this in my bathroom, and I like the convenience of having Alexa in the bathroom without having to sacrifice an outlet or counter space to fit another device. The nightlight feature also works well.
customer_reviews.author: Sea Panther

customer_reviews.title: Good motion sensing light, needs bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: Relatively easy to install if you have a neutral wire. Small enough to fit into a standard size rectangle box. Alexa works pretty well but I do have to yell at it. Sound quality is actually pretty good for a light switch but otherwise a bit tinny. I really wish it had Bluetooth to play music on a bluetooth speaker. That would be pretty sweet. Sometimes the settings made on the app like inactivity timeout don't always get through and you'll wonder why your light is on at midnight. Running the app a second time usually solves it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M. Kinstle III

customer_reviews.title: Not a room sensor. Don’t buy for that reason!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this primarily as an additional sensor to my ecobee. Yes, it’s a light switch. But if I wanted a motion detecting light switch I would have bought one at Home Depot for $20-30. I was sold when I read almost two years ago that it could be used as a room sensor. Fast forward to today and I’m still being told it’s coming. I stopped holding my breath. It’s not coming.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Rudolph

customer_reviews.title: Great switch for garage
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great switch for my garage. I use the photo sensor feature to automatically turn on my lights when I enter the garage and they then turn off after a couple of minutes (can be changed). The sensor works well so if you are working in garage, light will stay on. Also, because this has Alexa built in, I can use it to access Alexa. All in all an excellent device. Easy to install. I do not have it connected to my thermostat yet, nor will I because of it being in garage, but it fulfills all my needs without being used as another thermostat point.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great features/needs special wiring
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for the integrated Alrxa and well as hands-free automatic lighting. It's great! It turns the lights on by motion sensor even when my hands are full. It is a tad too sensitive though being triggered by the wind blowing the trees. I use Alex's intercom feature ALL THE TIME! I am disabled and it helps me communicate with my husband in other parts of our home.Unfortunately, my electrician had to run a new line, because I didn't have the wired necessary,
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl

customer_reviews.title: The first switch having a constant high pitches humming sound like a subwoofer with a grounding issue
customer_reviews.text: This is a first generation product with first generation problems. It has design shortcomings, technical issues and manufacturing issues. I purchased three switches. Two out of the three have issues. The first switch having a constant high pitches humming sound like a subwoofer with a grounding issue. The second switch would turn in the lights at random times with no movement in the room. I double-checked the switch that would turn on at random times by placing an ecobee 4 sensor next to it. The ecobee 4 sensor saw no movement. In both cases, support is issuing a replacement. It’s been three weeks and still waiting for my replacement. Fail, Fail, Fail!!!
customer_reviews.author: W. Ching

customer_reviews.title: Overall I love the Switch+
customer_reviews.text: Overall I love the Switch+. The features are awesome, especially now that they added the "do not disturb" feature for the motion sensor. I do agree that they still have some kinks to work out such as the delay for Alexa to respond, but there is a huge potential for this product. Also, can't wait for them to implement the temperature sensor feature for their thermostats. This is MUCH better than having a separate Echo Dot in all of our rooms, and works awesome to replace the zigbee/wifi switches I already had.
customer_reviews.author: Paul A Rehm

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this switch :( I have an Ecobee thermostat and was excited by the fact that I wouldn’t need yet another app for a new smart devise.... but I have all but given up on the built in Alexa, so basically I spent a ton of $ on a motion switch with auto-off. I am constantly having to restart the switch in order to get Alexa to respond to either voice command or the push button on top of the switch.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Marchini

customer_reviews.title: Light switch with alexa
customer_reviews.text: Had problem with initial install and had to reset breaker to work. Good range on mic for Alexa commands when it worked. Had several faults but restored itself. Like automatic on when near switch. Only works on single pole like replacement switches. Limited places where can install. Have several rooms with combination light and fan control switches. The Alexa feature is non functional now after 6 months of use. I downgraded my rating from 4 to 2. I contacted support spent 45 minutes trying to get fixed no luck. Told me to initialize on WiFi router — no luck.
customer_reviews.author: Smokey Stover

customer_reviews.title: A very good light switch that could be great
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good light switch. It can be controlled and automated in some very easy and simple steps. The price is a bit on the high side but you can easily recoup that on your energy savings. Think no more empty kids room with lights on all day long. However, I would strongly suggest for ecobee to add motion sensor zone management. This would allow users to manage the reach of the motion sensor, and prevent the light to be turned on when people walk by a room but doesn't get inside the room.
customer_reviews.author: Marco

customer_reviews.title: Switch+ is the "swiss army knife" of smart switches. Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this switch for almost a month, and have been very pleased with it. Installation was very easy for me, ecobee provides help via their app, if needed. WIFI, Ecobee, SmartThings, and Alexa syncing were easily accomplished within minutes. The motion sensor works well, nightlight feature is great, and the sound is better than expected for such a small device.The Switch+ has been a great addition to my smart home, and I am looking forward to more features being added through updates coming soon.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: You can't control the lights by talking to it. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely unimpressed with this switch. The whole reason we bought it was to be able to voice control the lights in our bedroom but it's like we paid $90 for a echo dot that is in the wall. It won't connect to the ecobee thermostat in the house for temperature control and you can't voice control the lights. It has a motion sensor for lights but since it is for the bedroom and we don't want to wake up the other person sleeping by getting out of bed that is off too. Just get another dot and light switch to connect to it. It's cheaper and more effective.
customer_reviews.author: K. Wolff

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: I think it’s great. Easy to set up if you make sure you have all the wires required. I had an ecobee thermostat prior. (Which is also easy to add to my smartphone via the app). You can change the time frame for when it turns off after it turns on after finding movement in the room! I change the time to a shorter frame and it works great. Love that I don’t have to turn it on because I forget you have to press it vs a switch. Having an Alexa in my kitchen that I can use to set a timer is wonderful. If I had more rooms I use more freuqeuntly I would buy another.
customer_reviews.author: P. Taft

customer_reviews.title: Great feature set, but motion sensor very slow to react
customer_reviews.text: I bought this switch to replace an older non-WiFi Motion Sensing light switch that was not happy being in a gang box with WiFi switches (causing false triggers). As a motion sensing switch, I am impressed with Ecobee’s feature set and ease of use, but the main feature I’m looking for (motion sensing) is incredibly slow to react. Since I’m so new to the product, I’m going to continue using it to see how it goes after a little bit of time, but would love to see a firmware update that addresses the speed of its motion sensitivity.
customer_reviews.author: Adam R

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty well. Sound is pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well. Sound is pretty good. Does a good job of voice activation for the light that it is hooked up to. It is pretty straightforward to install. I like it but it is a bit expensive so just keep that in mind and that is primarily the reason I took one star away. So far not a lot of capability outside of dusk till dawn automatic lights and automatic nightlight. Both functions you can turn on and off. Nevertheless, I think it is pretty good. Like others said, the sound quality is not bad for a tiny speaker in a light switch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome switch with the Queen of smart home, Alexa
customer_reviews.text: Love this new switch for our guest bathroom. Set it up as an occupancy sensor for auto on/off for the bathroom light. Tried Alexa and was surprised how well it works in a tiny device. The voice is clearly heard, even music was loud and adequate for a small guest bathroom. No issues with nearby Alexa devices. Love it so much that I will put one in every bathroom in our home. I had trouble setting up WiFi for the switch, using my iPhone X. Tried it several times and not sure what happened. I then tried it with my iPad and works fine. I need to set it up with HomeKit later too. Heard it was easy as well.
customer_reviews.author: HLN

customer_reviews.title: Cool but does not do everything that amazon devices can do
customer_reviews.text: Very cool smart switch that has a built in night light and proximity sensing. We received as a gift and installed immediately. The instal was fairly simple and the integration to Alexa was easy. The switch integrates several of the Alexa features but does not support most routines ( will do some voice based routines) as well as drop in and cannot be integrated into device / music groups. There is no amazon branded switch that is comparable so I wish it was able to do the same features.
customer_reviews.author: NWH

customer_reviews.title: I like the switch with the Alexa feature
customer_reviews.text: I like the switch with the Alexa feature, but do not expect a lot of information either written or on their app regarding setting the switch up. I had to install a range extender in order to have full operation of Alexa (even though I have camera's streaming just fine in the same area), plus the ability to program the on/off operation of the switch is very limited compared to the versatility of the routines and SmartApps in SmartThings. Internal motion detector works great, but it does not appear to give you access as a trigger for other SmartThing devices. Product has potential but it is not there yet.
customer_reviews.author: Babs

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t integrate with smart home hubs.
customer_reviews.text: It’s easy to install and has built in Alexa. So far so good. But, the Alexa integration is anemic. Setting a reminder e.g. doesn’t work. We have it installed by the front door and would like to say ‘remind me at 7pm to...’ - doesn’t work. Worst thing is, is doesn’t integrate with anything. Anemic IFTT, no wink. You can’t have the motion sensor trigger a video, or do other things. So, it’s pretty isolated to the ecobee app - a big letdown if you want to do actual smart home automation. Smarthings allegedly works but only as a switch and not a sensor.
customer_reviews.author: Stefan Piesche

customer_reviews.title: Cool on paper, unusable in practice
customer_reviews.text: After owning it for a while the constant wifi connectivity problems make it basically unusable. I'm getting 1 in 4 of my requests at best being processed correctly with 5-15 second lockouts between attempts. Even "stop" isn't reliably honored. It only registers as a light switch in smartthings so you can't use its motion sensor or thermostat. Alexa integration is barely better since it can't be added to speaker groups. Maybe other ecobee products are good. This isn't one of them.
customer_reviews.author: James Endicott

customer_reviews.title: Misleading marketing
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never written a review before. I’m so disappointed in the switch. I feel deceived. The only reason I purchased it was for the temperature sensor (I got a great deal on the switch in conjunction with some promos that I couldn’t get on an actual room sensor)... which isn’t available yet, even though marketing makes it very easy to mistake that it is. Ecobee has been promising to push the software update for this feature for over a year. Give me a break. Also the built in Alexa is a joke. Look elsewhere at better prices, better functioning smart switches
customer_reviews.author: SarahB

customer_reviews.title: Works great - I am really pleased
customer_reviews.text: I am really pleased with this Switch - perfect for the kids bathroom where they constantly were moving various Alexa devices in there to listen to. We’ve always had motion sensing light switches to reduce the constant “leaving the lights on” issue - this switch sensed motion at night and turns off after 15 min. The sound/volume is fine - not quiet but not loud (just as I’d expect). Price is a little steep but this actually really works well for this household. Installation was fairly easy - no different then swapping out any other light switch. I had no issues with getting the app to see the switch (iPhone). Great product - may get another.
customer_reviews.author: Todd A

customer_reviews.title: The Switch+ is great in several ways
customer_reviews.text: The Switch+ is great in several ways. I'll use it to ask Alexa to get the weather. That is about the extent of my Alexa usage on it. I love how it will quickly turn lights on and off by hitting the button/switch. All other 'smart' switches have a very noticeable delay. I also take full advantage of the sensor to turn on the light when there is motion. This is probably one of my favorite features. It is very snappy to sense and turn on the light.
customer_reviews.author: OICU812

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the current price
customer_reviews.text: At $90, it leads people to assume there's a lot it can do. But it's simply a smart switch with built-in Alexa, and when you look at it like that, it's about 50% overpriced. For my purposes, I'd relatively satisfied. It's a smart switch with a motion sensor, and has Alexa built into it. I have it near a work bench, and it's really become very useful in that location. I like it, but it's far too expensive for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: sw

customer_reviews.title: Neat switch, works pretty well
customer_reviews.text: So far, I like this fairly well. I use it in my study and I play the radio on it when I'm in there. I like the auto on and auto off features. I'm also looking forward to it being enabled as a room sensor for my thermostat with the next update release. I'm deducting one star because I frequently have to say "Alexa" loudly multiple times to get it's attention. More sensitive microphones would be great. Otherwise, it works as expected.
customer_reviews.author: MattH007

customer_reviews.title: New kind of motion sensor switch
customer_reviews.text: Had a really old motion sensor in the garage that wasn't working anymore. Decided to look at this switch because we already had ecobee thermostat. Installation and setup took less than 10 minutes. Love the smart features, too. Going to get another one for a different location in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Barreto

customer_reviews.title: Literally 0 problems, works great
customer_reviews.text: We got this as a Christmas present for our son. He loves it. I installed it with no issues, and got it setup within a few minutes. He uses it everyday to turn the light on/off and ask Alexa things. Alexa will hear him and respond even if he's not in the room. It seems to work very well for us over the last 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Van Alstyne

customer_reviews.title: switch works, but lack of 3-way install is a problem
customer_reviews.text: lack of 3 way installation serverly limits install options. as my home has all 3 way switches there was no place to install it so had to send it back. i love the thermostat, it's great. if they come out with another switch with a 3 way function, then i'll buy it but otherwise this is going back to amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck T

customer_reviews.title: Ecobee is the company to watch in the smart home space
customer_reviews.text: It’s good but worth waiting for version 2.0. The hardware or process spends to much time thinking before giving a response. That despite being in a home with excellent WiFi and speedy connection to the internet. Also the night light is only high or off. It’s not possible to reduce its intensity
customer_reviews.author: A. K. K. Sheibany

customer_reviews.title: It is good but you have to have patience!
customer_reviews.text: The product is good, but I think the Alexa's version built in, must be so old because it works similar to my 1st Alexa's Amazon Echo, and in another hand... Despite these devices (I have 3 of them) are in my network, they don't have integration or communication with my other two Amazon echo, sometimes when we speak to it, it shows an orange light indicating it doesn't have Internet connection.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Patiño

customer_reviews.title: Not working properly
customer_reviews.text: My ecobee light switch was installed and it worked fine, now it is turning the ligh that it is connected to on its own. I command it to turn the light off, and it works and then at some point it just turns the lights on and they dont go off without another command, but stay off only for a short period of time...If anyone knows why let me know....
customer_reviews.author: Patti English

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work as a room sensor
customer_reviews.text: The Alexa integration is better than stated (routines and Pandora work even though they're not supposed to), but the wifi connection is flaky and it still doesn't work as an Ecobee room sensor even though that feature was supposed to happen last summer (2018).
customer_reviews.author: Navarre

customer_reviews.title: love ecobee and their products
customer_reviews.text: You can never go wrong with Ecobee. Super easy to install. Does the same as Nest but much more affordable. I just wish it also worked as a dimmer. My girlfriend now has some company in the kitchen, and i dont even need to be there
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: False advertisment so far
customer_reviews.text: I am giving this one star due to the fact that the temperature sensor is not functional, even though this was supposed to be available in 2018. Also, seems they are unable to even respond to a question as to when this is to be expected. Will adjust this review is the situation changes.
customer_reviews.author: charles eric starkey

customer_reviews.title: Not ready and needs work to improve Alexa experience
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Attractive looking device. Physical installation was relatively easy. Great night light functionality. Responsive while using app for on/off functionality. Cons: Alexa does not work well at all. If you speak a command, even as simple as what time is it, it will think for 10 seconds and advise it is having problems more than 9 out of 10 times. Considering this is the primary reason I tried one of these over a WeMo switch (which I have several), this has been highly disappointing. I am hoping this issue gets fixed. I am feeling the pain of being an early adopter and wish I had waited until the kinks get worked out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: I received this as a gift. It’s main advantage for me is that it does not require a a fourth wire (neutral wire). It works perfectly for what I wanted. Now what I would like is this switch without “Alexa” built in with a cheaper price. I already have enough echos I do not need one in the switch. Then add dimming and that switch would be 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: GaryK

customer_reviews.title: An attempt was made
customer_reviews.text: Unit can not be used as a temp sensor for the ecobee thermostats. The speaker is audible. Alexa cannot hear you over the speaker tho. Motion sensor works well. After reading about this switch and contacting their customer support, it seems like they had good intentions when they released this product but were never able to develop it like they wanted. They tried to get the temp sensor to work but never made it happened then gave up. (Short hand summery of what their support told me). I think they tried to pack to much into a single device. I only bought it because it was half price and i have ecobee thermostats already. Buyer beware
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: had trouble setting up because my house wiring was incorrect. If you have a neutral wire the instructions are clear. I had to have an electrician repair the original location, and he set this up in a different "correctly wired" switch. I love the convenience and the nite light motion sensor. Got me addicted to "Alexa" and voice activated controls.
customer_reviews.author: Howard Spencer

customer_reviews.title: The everything switch!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these today from Best Buy. I love them. I just bought 3 more from Amazon this evening. They connected very easily. They quickly discovered my ecobee Thermostat and tantan smart plugs. The little speaker is remarkably capable. I really like the night light feature. This thing has all bases covered - it's a motion sensor, an occupancy sensor, voice activated, seemingly full Alexa capabilities, and if you'd like an old fashioned push button switch!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Ballin

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Installed it today, absolutely love it. Connected it to Alexa and works great. Very happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Wil - Connecticut

customer_reviews.title: Just buy the Alexa and a compatible light switch
customer_reviews.text: This product works sometimes and sometimes it don’t. When Alexa is engaged it is hard to stop. You have to yell in order for it to stop and sometimes it doesn’t respond. In the meantime, your other Alexa in the house hear the command from the other room now it’s talking. The switch has a night light on it and it detects motion and comes on automatically but when you have the lights off and trying to enjoy a movie and you so happen to stretch the light is coming on. Overall, the light is ok to have but glitches need to be fixed.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Just buy the regular Alexa
customer_reviews.text: When it works it’s great for most of the time it doesn’t and it overheats and some of them you hear a humming noise kind of scary to think he can cause a fire from overheating and this is not coming from just buying one it’s from buying multiple
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Smart Light Switch
customer_reviews.text: I had a little bit of trouble with the setup of this, but the Ecobee Support is excellent, and they walked me right through it. Ends up it was my fault, as I had forgot to complete one step in the setup.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Basic Alexa functions, but no drop-in support
customer_reviews.text: There need to be clear warnings in the description for this device alerting potential buyers to the fact that it does not support the full set of Alexa features. No drop-in support means you cannot use this as an intercom. If all you want is the ability to turn a light on and off, and check the weather or other basic Alexa skills, this is a decent device, but if you want to integrate a room with your Alexa ecosystem, get an Echo Dot instead, as this device lacks key features.
customer_reviews.author: Steven K

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup, electrical install was straightforward, built-in Alexa was a selling point. Don’t setup using HomeKit if you also use Alexa, do the eco bee in-app setup first and then HomeKit
customer_reviews.author: J.T. Sodano

customer_reviews.title: Works well with Alexa
customer_reviews.text: With the sale price that includes motion, timer, and Alexa, its a great product. Keep in mind the wifi is not that strong so you will want to make sure have have a strong wifi signal.
customer_reviews.author: ReviewPlus

customer_reviews.title: not worth it
customer_reviews.text: complete waste of time, and now it's annoying. it is an always on listening device in my living room, which alone makes me regret my decision. now, it's even better! Now it randomly hears something and starts talking in my living room while I'm watching tv and I can't seem to find a way to deprogram it, and will have to waste an afternoon wiring a standard wifi switch in.
customer_reviews.author: Bryant Marx

customer_reviews.title: No Dim feature, Does not work as thermostat sensor, Alexa does not recognize it as a switch.
customer_reviews.text: I had to bridge the switch through Smart Things for the Alexa App to see it as an actual switch, does not have a dim feature which was surprising given the price. Still does not function as a sensor for my Ecobee thermostat which is a major let down. I also have to speak very loud for Alexa to her me.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Barker

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Great idea. Disconnects at times. Very random. But not too often. By biggest gripe is it can’t do group music or announcements. That needs to be fixed, hopefully in an update. Very attractive looking in my wall
customer_reviews.author: Q

customer_reviews.title: Only thing missing is Bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: After a quick update all problems were fixed.. the only thing i Dislike about it now is you cant connect external speakers With bluetooth. It worth the purchase if you have a need and don't need Bluetooth
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great switch, needs more features enabled.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great switch. I have an ecobee 3 thermostat, so I bought this to enchance the temperature sensor. I'm disappointed that they still haven't enabled this feature. The ecobee website says the temperature feature is coming soon, but not soon enough if you ask me. The switch works well with my Alexa (Echo Dots) and SmartThings powered smart home.
customer_reviews.author: CMac

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: The first one I installed took about half the estimated time as I ended I needing to go over the instructions. The second switch took only about 2 minutes. The overall function of this switch became far more useful than what I expected and the largest downfall to this product other than price is how addictive it can be causing lust to have them for every switch.
customer_reviews.author: Kenith Reed

customer_reviews.title: Mess up with my entire wifi network
customer_reviews.text: Got this with the Ecobee thermostat, but is awful, As soon as I connected my entire wifi network stopped working correctly, the rest of the smart devices were often unresponsive, I even bought a new wifi router and I had the same problems, finally I’ve removed this and the wifi started working correctly again, the device must interfere with the signal or something, don’t recommend buying this at all, I’ll stick with the tplink switches and the dots
customer_reviews.author: Pablo

customer_reviews.title: Smart switch that works with other devices! No dimmer though
customer_reviews.text: Another great product from Ecobee! I have the thermostat and decided to give this switch a try. I'm satisfied! The built-in Alexa is a plus while the motion detection is very convenient. On top of that, this thing works with SmartThings so this works as a switch which can be programmed with other devices in the SmartThings network. The only thing to improve with this is to support dimming and multi switches.
customer_reviews.author: DiLioPi

customer_reviews.title: Light doesn't work with alexa
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. Barely works with Alexa, and even worse. The light won't even turn in when you tell it to turn in. It says the device isn't compatible with Alexa. I like other functions. But it doesn't do what it was purchased to do.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis B.

customer_reviews.title: Is it the perfect switch? No
customer_reviews.text: Is it the perfect switch? No. But it has a lot of features that most switches don’t. Auto on/off, night light, and Alexa! It is compatible with Homekit which I wasn’t expecting and this summer it will report temperatures from the room it is installed in to your ecobee thermostat. I like it and use it often.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy. Mic is weak, product fails
customer_reviews.text: Product failed after 1 month. I have 2 of these and both started acting strange after just a few weeks. One has stopped working completely, the other one won't turn on and off using the front button most of the time. Bad buy, stay away.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: continues wifi disconnection
customer_reviews.text: good design and purpose but dont work some time bz having issue with wifi connection some time half day or more
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Switch issues
customer_reviews.text: Switch has great functions but I have had to replace twice due to the switch not working. Would not reset, no manual function, completely dead. Tech support is good but too many steps to troubleshoot the issue knowing the eventually outcome of replacment. I did not purchase through Amazon but feel important enough to post here for others. We also have an Ecobee thermostat that works great. Would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Bowman S.

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to A. family
customer_reviews.text: All functions work great ... motion detection extremely sensitive. But it’s nice be able shutoff everything from under the covers. Executes Alexa routines well.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Jeff

customer_reviews.title: No temperature sensing after it was promised
customer_reviews.text: Promised temperature sensor capability in Fall 2018. Never happened. No progress updates.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M. Santeler

customer_reviews.title: A half baked product
customer_reviews.text: It cannot make or receive Alexa calls (but it receices broadcast announcements) You can only play Amazon Music (no iTunes, Pandora, etc.) The cover plate will not snap, no matter how tight or loose the switch is screwed into the wall.
customer_reviews.author: LA Movie Buff

customer_reviews.title: Alexa in a  Integration is spotty
customer_reviews.text: Alexa Integration is not the best. I have Second generation echo dots that pick up with a lot more consistency even though they’re further away. Also, I noticed this drops off line far more than an Echo Dot. I’d say if the price was under 40.00 they would be a ok buy. Much more and I’d say no.
customer_reviews.author: 559caliguy

customer_reviews.title: Great Switch
customer_reviews.text: This Switch was easy to install and worked the first time. The Alexa features are disappointing at best. Don't think this is a full Alexa. It is more of a Lexi. Does most of the stuff just not as well
customer_reviews.author: Stephen K

customer_reviews.title: Great switch for entryway!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, works exactly how I needed it to. Only complaint is that it drops WiFi occasionally which makes Alexa support unreliable
customer_reviews.author: Ryan M.

customer_reviews.title: Great for bathroom
customer_reviews.text: Great for a place where you don’t want an alexa device taking up space on your counter.
customer_reviews.author: James J.

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: It works sometimes. Sometimes not. Doesn’t appear as a proper speaker or hub in some menus. Good if you need just need a easy good looking point to contact Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My Go-To Hair Product
customer_reviews.text: This is the product I go to every time I style my hair. It has enough hold to do what I need but also keep the hair looking natural and not greasy. Also a little product goes a long way.
customer_reviews.author: Nolan

customer_reviews.title: Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Great switch. I love that you can play music from the switch and also motion sensor comes in handy. Gives your house a little tech upgrade..your friends and family will think it's cool
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Doan

customer_reviews.title: Cool switch w/ Alexa
customer_reviews.text: What a great price for a smart switch! Great that this product includes Alexa! Sound is good from the little speaker. App is easy to use and integrates with the ecobee thermostat. The smart on/off feature works well. The mounting ears are plastic not metal and causes it to stick out a bit when using the not included cover plate.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Sherk

customer_reviews.title: Very good value
customer_reviews.text: Works great and is well worth it but needs to be restarted about once every 15 days.
customer_reviews.author: dustin owen

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: works great, Alexa integration is awesome as i use this to control the switch on a daily timer.
customer_reviews.author: Carmine

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful device
customer_reviews.text: Weousing it in the bathroom. Nice to have it tired into alexia and be able to get the news, weather, correct time, music audio books just to name a few
customer_reviews.author: joan leuchten

customer_reviews.title: Complete garbage, not even close to an Alexa product
customer_reviews.text: After installing it often had to be reset and when it did work it was slow to respond. After a few weeks, it stopped working completely. Don't waste your time with this POS.
customer_reviews.author: buyer081612

customer_reviews.title: Unspeakable
customer_reviews.text: This product doesn’t stay connected to WiFi, the ONLY smart product in our house that has issues. Works whenever it feels like it and you practically have to speak into it like a microphone to hear you
customer_reviews.author: Corina Savoie

customer_reviews.title: The installation was easy but if setting for mic is not enable in ...
customer_reviews.text: The installation was easy but if setting for mic is not enable in app it doesn't work but after talking to support it was a snap love it . .and the support was excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Grace Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good if you like the light to stay on a long time
customer_reviews.text: You cannot change how long the light comes on. 15 min is just ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: catlover

customer_reviews.title: Auto off lights!
customer_reviews.text: As a dad, I recommend these for all bathrooms and laundry rooms. Auto lights off and eventually drop in calling to yell for TP, or order more.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Pierson

customer_reviews.title: this switch works great
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what I needed and so simple to install. I did it myself and I'm far from an electrician. The illustrations are outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo D.

customer_reviews.title: This smart switch hits ALMOST all the boxes I want
customer_reviews.text: I love the Switch+. It has met all of the needs I wanted. These include ease of installation, ease of use, motion activation on entry, Homekit sync and Alexa integration. The one thing I am waiting for that would cause me to give it 5 stars would be the promised Temp sensor sync with my Ecobee 4.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Brinsfield

customer_reviews.title: Speaker has gone out.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in Feb 2020, it's now July and the speaker has gone out completely over the last two weeks. It just makes a feedback sound and that's it. Now I have to replace the switch again.
customer_reviews.author: Brian O.

customer_reviews.title: Do not say “Alexa turn off”
customer_reviews.text: Do not say “Alexa turn off“ because it will mess it up tiny bit
customer_reviews.author: Enrique Rosero

customer_reviews.title: Reliable product that totally meets expectations.
customer_reviews.text: One of th best I’ve come across. Easy to install and setup. Does everything I need and expect it to do. Planning on expanding my collection now that I’ve seen how well it works. I’ve had it for a while now. I bought it for my brother for his birthday. Very reliable product.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Mowry

customer_reviews.title: Can't play my Amazon music
customer_reviews.text: Mic not good enough have to yell ay this 1
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: One Of The Best Smart Switches Out There!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, and the volume can be adjusted within the app as it comes with a defaulted volume level. Wish it had a dimmer feature and that is why i gave it only 4 stars, but would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Zach Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works well set up a little difficult but does the job enjoying it very much
customer_reviews.author: doug macdermott

customer_reviews.title: Trash programmers
customer_reviews.text: Great idea. Trash programming. Save your money. Electrical engineering speaking. Not worth your time. Buy a dot and smart switch. Less aggravating and will actually work
customer_reviews.author: Jenaica Corinealdi

product_meta.title: ecobee Switch+ Smart Light Switch, Amazon Alexa Built-in
product_meta.description:
Eco bee Switch+ delivers smart lighting and Alexa in one seamless package. Ask it to turn the lights on or off, set a timer, read you the news or weather, play music or podcasts, and more (nothing else required). Forgot to turn the light off? Smart Off takes care of that for you when the room is empty. All this, one switch-that you can install yourself in about 45 minutes.

Wiring: Neutral and ground wire required,Automatic line and load wire switching.

Dimensions: Switch+: Height: 106 mm (4.17 in.),Width: 45 mm (1.8 in.),Depth: 50 mm (2 in.)
Wall plate: Height: 119 mm (4.7 in.),Width: 45 mm (2.95 in.),Depth: 7 mm (0.3 in.)

Electrical requirements: Rating: 120V AC 60Hz,600W incandescent,150W LED and CFL,Neutral wire required,Works with single/double/multi-switch,Not compatible with 3-way switches,Rocker style plates.

Connectivity: Wi-Fi, IEEE 802.11 b/g/n @ 2.4 GHz,Wi-Fi Protected Access (WPA/WPA2) and Wired Equivalent Privacy (WEP),DHCP (dynamic) Transport Layer Security (TLS),915 MHz. Bandwidth: 15+ MB/month (dependent on Alexa Voice Service usage)

Sustainability: Recycled packaging,Mercury-free,Arsenic-free,PVC-free,ROHS compliant
feature_bullets: BEYOND SMART LIGHTING: With built-in motion detection, ambient light sensors, and built-in Alexa you can control your home’s lighting like never before.
EASILY INSTALL YOURSELF: It only takes about 45 minutes, thanks to an in-app step-by-step walkthrough and handy videos. Everything you need comes in the box—no need for an electrician.
CONTROL FROM ANYWHERE: Don’t feel like getting off the couch? No problem. Use the Eco bee mobile app on your Android or iOS device to switch the lights on or off – or just go ahead and Ask Alexa.
BUILT-IN ALEXA: Switch the lights on and off, control other parts of your smart home, or ask Alexa to play music, hear the news, set a timer, adjust the temperature, and so much more.

specifications.Included Components: Decorative Trim Plate, Wire Nuts, Installation Instructions, Ecobee Switch+ Smart Light Switch
specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars393 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
